DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient is receiving a stable dose of warfarin and has an in-range INR or receiving a stable dose of heparin.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to patient warfarin treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: An anticoagulant that acts by inhibiting the synthesis of vitamin K-dependent coagulation factors. Warfarin is indicated for the prophylaxis and/or treatment of venous thrombosis and its extension, pulmonary embolism, and atrial fibrillation with embolization. It is also used as an adjunct in the prophylaxis of systemic embolism after myocardial infarction. Warfarin is also used as a rodenticide.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An anticoagulant that acts by inhibiting the synthesis of vitamin K-dependent coagulation factors. Warfarin is indicated for the prophylaxis and/or treatment of venous thrombosis and its extension, pulmonary embolism, and atrial fibrillation with embolization. It is also used as an adjunct in the prophylaxis of systemic embolism after myocardial infarction. Warfarin is also used as a rodenticide.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient receiving a st
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving a stable dose of warfarin and has an in-range INR or receiving a stable dose of heparin

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient having ongoing treatment with therapeutic doses of warfarin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require therapeutic doses of coumadin or equivalent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently receiving or has received warfarin or acenocoumarol within the past 7 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require concomitant treatment, in therapeutic doses, with anti-coagulants such as warfarin or warfarin-related agents, heparin, thrombin or Factor Xa inhibitors or antiplatelet agents (i.e. clopidogrel)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received therapeutic dose of warfarin?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received therapeutic dose of warfarin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Low-dose Coumadin (1mg) is acceptable; however, doses that increase the INR are not permitted. If an alternative to Coumadin-based anticoagulants cannot be used, the INR should be monitored weekly after initiation of therapy and upon discontinuation of INCB024360, until INR normalization.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are they on a stable dose and have no underlying abnormality in coagulation parameters per medical history?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient therapeutically treated with an agent such as warfarin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient therapeutically treated with an agent such as warfarin or heparin?
